unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: Drawing Conclusions
question_text: ​A hotel manager wishes to compare the number of guests she has per night to a competitor hotel's guests per night in town. The manager records the number of guests staying per night during the last $4\text{ weeks}$ at her hotel and compares them to numbers for the last $4\text{ weeks}$ at the competitor. The manager performs a two-sample $T$ -Interval (her hotel - competitor’s hotel) and gets the values of $28.54$ to $32.56$ at $95\%$ confidence. What could be a valid conclusion of this interval?​

choices.text: We are 95 % 95 % confident the hotel manager has between 28.54 28.54 and 32.56 guests 32.56 guests per night at her hotel.
We are 95 % 95 % confident there are between 28.54 28.54 and 32.56 guests 32.56 guests per night at the competitor’s hotel.
There is evidence the manager’s hotel gets more guests than her competitor’s hotel, significant at the 5 % 5 % level.
We are 95 % 95 % confident there are between 28.54 28.54 and 32.56 32.56 more guests per night at the manager’s hotel than at the competitor’s hotel.
